title: Ticket #4813: Infinite recursion with ClassAd eval() function
description:
In the ClassAd library, it's possible to set up an infinite recursion during evaluation when using the eval() function in an expression.

With the following ClassAd, evaluating attribute A or B2 will overflow the stack. 

[
  A = eval("A");
  B = "eval(B)";
  B2 = eval(B);
]

The EvalState object prevents infinite recursion when there's a loop in attribute references, by halting the evaluation when it has gone more than 1000 levels deep. We should do the same for eval() calls.
